abstract: While Google remains the dominant search engine, its grasp on the mobile market is slipping in the face of increased competition from “native” applications designed for pocket-size devices.
snippet: While Google remains the dominant search engine, its grasp on the mobile market is slipping in the face of increased competition from “native” applications designed for pocket-size devices.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Many businesses around the world could wake up on Tuesday to discover their search ranking has been downgraded. After a monthslong warning period, Google will add “mobile friendliness” to the 200 or so factors it uses to list websites on its search engine.

headline.main: Google Adds ‘Mobile Friendliness’ to Its Search Criteria
headline.print_headline: Google Adds ‘Mobile Friendliness’ to Its Search Criteria
